questions.question: The three colors of the traffic lights are:

choices: you must yield to all pedestrians and other motorists using the intersection

questions.answer: go, it is safe to do so

questions.question: A flashing yellow light at a road crossing signifies:
choices: Caution - slow down and proceed with caution
Stop and stay until light stops flashing
questions.answer: Caution - slow down and proceed with caution

questions.question: A solid white line on the right edge of the highway slopes in towards your left. This shows that:
choices: there is an intersection joint ahead

questions.question: You are in a No-Passing zone when the center of the road is marked by:
When arrows are painted on the pavement, drivers must:
choices: must go in the direction of the arrows
slow down and prepare to yield right of way
are not allowed to change lanes
questions.answer: must go in the direction of the arrows

questions.question: You may not drive across solid yellow lines except to:
Double solid yellow lane lines:
choices: should not be crossed except with due care

questions.question: You may not cross a single broken white of yellow line:
choices: when turning left into a driveway
when passing to the right on a one-way street

questions.answer: when to do so would interfere with traffic

questions.question: You may cross over a double line on the road to overtake another car if the line on your side is:

choices: wait for the green light before proceeding
slow down and proceed with caution
come to a full stop and proceed when it is safe to do so

questions.question: Which of the following hand signals must a driver give when he wants to slow down and stop?
choices: left arm bent at elbow, hand pointing up
left arm held straight in horizontal position
left arm held down and hand pointing at ground
questions.answer: left arm held down and hand pointing at ground

questions.question: The proper hand signal for right turn is:
choices: left arm bent at elbow, hand pointing up
left arm held straight in horizontal position
left arm held down and hand pointing at ground
questions.answer: left arm bent at elbow, hand pointing up

questions.question: If the driver ahead of you extends his left arm straight out, you are fairly sure that he is going to:
choices: turn left at the next intersection
pull off to the side of the road to stop
turn right at the next intersection
questions.answer: turn left at the next intersection

questions.question: When approaching a railway crossing with a signal device warning the approach of a train, you must:
choices: stop not less than 1.5 meters from the nearest rail
slow down and proceed with caution
pull off to the side of the road to stop
questions.answer: stop not less than 1.5 meters from the nearest rail

questions.question: Under what circumstances should you sound your horn?

yield the right-of-way if necessary to vehicles approaching from left or right
questions.answer: stop and proceed when it is safe to do so

choices: slow down then enter the intersection when the way is clear
questions.answer: slow down then enter the intersection when the way is clear

choices: rules for when to yield to others
questions.answer: rules for when to yield to others

choices: sound your horn to alert others

questions.question: At rotundas, which of the following vehicles have the right-of-way?
choices: vehicles which are just about to enter

questions.question: At an intersection with no control device, two cars approach at right angles to each other. Which driver must yield?
choices: the driver who gets there first
the driver who slows down first
the driver who gets there last
questions.answer: the driver who gets there last

questions.question: At an intersection with no control device, two cars approach from opposite directions. Which driver must yield?

choices: the driver who gets there first

questions.question: At an intersection without stop or yield signs, two cars reach the intersection at the same time. Which car has the right-of-way?
choices: the car that slows down first

questions.question: A car is positioned in an intersection waiting to turn left when the traffic signal light turns red. Who should go first?
choices: the driver caught in the intersection waiting to turn left
the driver making the right turn
the driver caught with the green light
questions.answer: the driver caught in the intersection waiting to turn left

questions.question: At an intersection without stop or yield signs, two cars approach from different streets. Which car has the right-of-way?
choices: the vehicle already in the intersection
the vehicle that slows down first
questions.answer: the vehicle already in the intersection

questions.question: The driver of a car traveling on a highway is required to yield to:
choices: any car coming out of a driveway
cars approaching an intersection from the left

choices: until at least two cars have passed
which are close enough to be dangerous
questions.answer: which are close enough to be dangerous

questions.question: If there are pedestrians on a school crossing, you are required to:
choices: stop and give way only to persons crossing from your right

stop and do not proceed until all persons are completely clear off the crossing
questions.answer: stop and do not proceed until all persons are completely clear off the crossing

questions.question: Should a driver turning at an intersection give way to pedestrians?

speed up to get out of the way

questions.question: When two vehicles meet on an upgrade road where neither cars pass, which of the two must yield?

choices: the lane nearest to the road center

questions.answer: the lane nearest the right curb

Monetary fine and one (1) year suspension of Driver's License and Motor Vehicle Registration
questions.answer: Monetary fine and one (1) year suspension of Driver's License and Motor Vehicle Registration

questions.question: Under R.A. 10054, what is the maximum penalty for not wearing a standard protective helmet?
choices: Monetary fine plus suspension of Driver's License
Monetary fine plus perpetual revocation of Driver's License
Monetary fine plus confiscation of Driver's License
questions.answer: Monetary fine plus confiscation of Driver's License

questions.question: One exception for a child to ride as passenger of a motorcycle along public roads of heavy volume and high density of fast moving vehicles and where a speed limit of more than 60 kph is:
choices: the child passenger can reach the shoulders of the driver
the child passenger requires immediate medical attention
the child passenger has parental consent
questions.answer: the child passenger requires immediate medical attention

questions.question: What should the motorcycle rider need to check?
choices: Saddle bag, top box, engine oil, transmission fluid, brake pedal, speedometer
Spare tire, brake pads and shoes, accelerator pedal
Motor vehicle overall condition before going anywhere
questions.answer: Motor vehicle overall condition before going anywhere

may move to the left-hand side of the road pass the long vehicle

plus 2-4 psi of the maximum pressure
exact psi of the maximum pressure

questions.question: What may be the cause for the battery to explode?
choices: Placing the battery on the ground

Let the two passengers board, if they want, and drop the nearest passenger first

speed through but flash your lights to oncoming traffic

the child can reach the knees of the driver
